p: The repulsion percentages obtained with some adults of Tribolium castaneum after one hour of their exposure to different doses of the Ruta chalepensis L. essential oil are summarized in Figure 3; it appears that the dose of 0.038 μl/ml represents a significant repellency (100%) after 15 min; the 0.031 μl/ml dose caused repulsion of all adults after 20 min of exposure while the dose of 0.023 μl/ml had no repulsive effect until 10 min of exposure and 100% of repulsion was reached after 25 min Figure 4.
